posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.53 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Reminder, if you are using Obtanium for betas to opt-in for pre-release tags.

Complete list of new commits since 7.52.2:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.52.2…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

This release has a bunch of changes made to our debuglog viewer, including search and filtering! Play around and let us know if you see any issues. Thanks!

jeffrey-signal:

Also, please let us know if you see any strange behavior related to images – we made some changes related to image loading (should be able to handle image files up to 200MP).

link_counts.title: Beta Feedback for the upcoming Android 7.52 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.53.0 (157200)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

41 new commits since 7.52.2:

Show commits

  • Use correct index when deleting old log lines. [1]

  • Ensure various log database indexes are used. [2]

  • Add notification profile size to local metrics. [3]

  • Fix backup instrumentation tests. [4]

  • Fix debug tool to insert messages with attachments. [5]

  • Default the number of JobRunners to 8. [6]

  • Use server rereg flag to show post reg restore flows. [7]

  • Do not make all instrumentation tests internal users. [8]

  • Increase parallelization of attachment archive uploads. [9]

  • Add parallelization options for archive attachment restoration. [10]

  • Fix large image file loading failures. [11]

    Replaces DecryptableStreamUriLoader with DecryptableUriStreamLoader, which addresses InvalidMarkException errors that were occurring when loading large image files with Glide. This new model loader provides a more robust approach via multiple fallback mechanisms to try to recover gracefully from errors related to displaying large images.

  • Skip media restoration if we're on the free tier. [12]

  • BackupDeleteJob integration tests. [13]

  • Add filter by log level feature in debug log screen. [14]

  • Dynamically calculate Glide stream mark limit based on device memory. [15]

    Replaces the hardcoded InputStreamRewinder.MARK_READ_LIMIT with a value that is calculated dynamically based on the device's RAM (scaling the mark read limit linearly between 5 to 8 MB).
    A larger limit will avoid unnecessary fail & retries on high-end devices and improve performance.

  • Allow back button to remove debug log filter. [16]

  • Perform zk check in check job. [17]

  • Fix potential ANR in debug log viewer. [18]

  • Ensure long text is excluded from pending archive size calculation. [19]

  • Do not retry thumbnails on terminal status codes. [20]

  • Update remote backup size display to indicate loading while accessing data. [21]

  • Fix a race condition with debuglogs viewing. [22]

  • Add debug info for archive upload progress. [23]

  • Remove old manual overrides for notification profiles. [24]

  • Add logging when we display different alert sheets via the delegate. [25]

  • Do not load entire log into memory. [26]

  • Fix notification profile override crash. [27]

  • Fix PNG animations. [28]

    Adds an InputStreamFactory APNG decoder so images animate correctly when loaded via the new DecryptableUriStreamLoader.

  • Fix attachment reconciliation bugs stemming from incorrect base64 encoded remote_key. [29]

  • Sync deletion of profiles with storage service. [30]

  • Fix issue where we could enqueue unsatisfiable jobs during registration. [31]

  • Improve link device good citizenship with backups. [32]

  • Fix proximity locking during voice calls. [33]

  • Rework MainActivity navigation to properly suppor empty state. [34]

  • Implement BackupSubscriptionCheckJob integration tests. [35]

  • Fix edit message import data bugs. [36]

  • Ensure uploaded logs match debug log viewer. [37]

  • Fix race condition where not all logs would be added to the viewer. [38]

  • Update translations and other static files. [39]

  • Update baseline profile. [40]

  • Bump version to 7.53.0 [41]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.52.2…v7.53.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution

posts.cooked: Nice! But is it by purpose that - even when scrolling fast - scrolling is being stopped after approx. 1 second?
Usually searching automatically shows the first found match. Debug logs searching shows 0th of X found search matches so you need to tap arrow to actually see some search result.

Usually, when - for example - scrolling only vertically a few lines while leaving the fingers on screen, a threshold prevents minimal (non-linear) finger movement in other directions (e.g. horizontally) from resulting in unsteady scroll experience (by kind of “locking” the scroll direction to a certain degree). The debug log viewer doesn’t have this.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Failed to restore a paid attachment from a while back. It just crashed when trying to download it. It was in theory in my backup and not on my device using the offloading feature.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.53.0-nightly-2025-08-13-23-38-25/35b0446fa881adb00403672044d00d63571c05389f8630ad70568fc93b65b95b


type: crash
osVersion: google/husky/husky:16/BP2A.250805.005/2025080600:user/release-keys
flags: dev options enabled
package: org.thoughtcrime.securesms.backup:157200, targetSdk 35
process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms.backup
processUptime: 9412 + 348 ms
installer: org.thoughtcrime.securesms.backup

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.backup.v2.DatabaseAttachmentArchiveUtil.requireMediaName-2wAzdYk(DatabaseAttachmentArchiveUtil.kt:28)
	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.backup.v2.DatabaseAttachmentArchiveUtilKt.requireMediaName(DatabaseAttachmentArchiveUtil.kt:82)
	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.backup.v2.DatabaseAttachmentArchiveUtilKt.createArchiveAttachmentPointer(DatabaseAttachmentArchiveUtil.kt:113)
	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.RestoreAttachmentJob.retrieveAttachment(RestoreAttachmentJob.kt:290)
	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.RestoreAttachmentJob.retrieveAttachment$default(RestoreAttachmentJob.kt:258)
	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.RestoreAttachmentJob.doWork(RestoreAttachmentJob.kt:220)
	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.RestoreAttachmentJob.onRun(RestoreAttachmentJob.kt:185)
	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.BaseJob.run(BaseJob.java:31)
	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobmanager.JobRunner.run(JobRunner.java:88)
	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobmanager.JobRunner.run(JobRunner.java:51)
	at [[ ↑↑ Original Trace ↑↑ ]].(:0)
	at [[ ↓↓ Exception Message ↓↓ ]].(:0)
	at null.(:0)

It was a download from way back then so I dunno if it was deleted or anything, since the app says my backup size is 5.7MB even though the app says it’s offloaded 1.06GB of data.

Additionally I still can’t find the option to enable or disable offloading.

When selecting a few characters in the debug log view, a floating button […] appears on the right side of the screen (in my case). Tapping it made this button disappear on the right side and reappearing on the left. Only when tapping it there, it expanded showing “Copy Find Palette…” or “Select Find All Palette…”. What is this button for, and why does it jump around?

Plus, when searching for a character (“a” and playing with the type filter settings), it seems I managed the view to crash and force-close:

greyson-signal:

This release has a bunch of changes made to our debuglog viewer, including search and filtering! Play around and let us know if you see any issues. Thanks!

Also, please let us know if you see any strange behavior related to images – we made some changes related to image loading (should be able to handle image files up to 200MP).

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
PiCob:

Nice! But is it by purpose that - even when scrolling fast - scrolling is being stopped after approx. 1 second?

PiCob:

Usually, when - for example - scrolling only vertically a few lines while leaving the fingers on screen, a threshold prevents minimal (non-linear) finger movement in other directions (e.g. horizontally) from resulting in unsteady scroll experience (by kind of “locking” the scroll direction to a certain degree). The debug log viewer doesn’t have this.

It’s just the editor, unfortunately. It’s ace.js. I may look into a different one in the future, but for now we’ll probably just live with the funny scrolling, even though it isn’t perfect. The main benefits we wanted to get were mostly concerning things like searching, filtering, and (in the future!) editing.

DirkPitt1:

Usually searching automatically shows the first found match. Debug logs searching shows 0th of X found search matches so you need to tap arrow to actually see some search result.

Ah yeah, will be in the next release

PiCob:

When selecting a few characters in the debug log view, a floating button […] appears on the right side of the screen (in my case).

Will be hidden in the next release!

PiCob:

Plus, when searching for a character (“a” and playing with the type filter settings), it seems I managed the view to crash and force-close:

Hmm, try as I might, I can’t get it to crash. Is it reproducible for you, and if so, could you give me more specific steps?

link_counts.title: Ace - The High Performance Code Editor for the Web

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked: A minor annoyance with the new beta: I’m using Signal in dark mode, and when I access the debug log screen the background flashes in white before switching to dark and loading the content.

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked:
Oof, that’s harsh. Can confirm that it happens to me, too. Samsung Galaxy S24U Ultra on OneUI 7.0 (Android 15).

Meta sidenote: this comment was created by replying to @fr33tux’s comment above (by tapping the reply icon on that comment, not the one below for the thread), but it wasn’t picked up as a reply to them, just the overall thread. Is this happening to others as well?

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
fr33tux:

A minor annoyance with the new beta: I’m using Signal in dark mode, and when I access the debug log screen the background flashes in white before switching to dark and loading the content.

I believe I’ve fixed this for 7.53.1.

FluffyPotato:

Some animated sticker packs are not animating, e.g. this one:

Taking a look!

Provide a debug log.

New Version: 7.53.1 (157300)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

6 new commits since 7.53.0:

  • Hide mobile context menu in debug log viewer. [1]

  • Jump to search result while typing in debuglog viewer. [2]

  • Detect priority-related unsatisfiable dependencies in jobs. [3]

  • Avoid flashing white when opening debuglog in dark theme. [4]

  • Update baseline profile. [5]

  • Bump version to 7.53.1 [6]
